rComments: Some people might give Mr. Scott some flak, but he is a good lecturer and he articulates conceptual material well. He sometimes doesn't give formulas but they are easy to find online or in the book. He had several classes to explicitly go over HW questions and his tests are 95% questions from HW with different numbers.

Clear lectures. He simplifies things to make them more easily understandable but doesn't leave out the difficult material. Pay attention to what he talks about in class; his tests can be easy if you pay attention or take you by surprise if you depend on the book more than lectures. The book is helpful but secondary to lectures.

I learned so much in Bill's class. The material is fascinating and he presents it in a very clear way. He is also hilarious which keeps the lectures very interesting. Exams are the perfect difficulty and he prepares  you well for them with the outstanding lectures and review sessions. Highly recommended, couldn't imagine a better intro to biochem.

Pay attentionunderstand  everything he says in lecture to get a good understanding of the material (he puts up podcasts). The questions make you think. The 1rst test was hard so he didn't put crazy questions on the next two. Go to class; sometimes he tells you important stuff before he starts recording the class. Overall, the class is doable.

Very straight forward and very clear during all lectures. He has no tricks but his tests aren't easy. Go to class daily and just go to section. Scott is very clear of what he wants you to learn. Ended up with an A in the class and all i did was just go to class. I studied a total of probably 3 days for the whole quarter outside of class.
Scott is the funniest professor at UCSC.  Course is too easy, but don't expect A+ if you work hard...

Know your amino acids, nucleotide structures, and read Ch.1-2 in Molecules of Life text before class starts (it is review material and you can fall behind quickly). Do the homework, it is 10% (hw is in weekly quiz). His tests are fair, he does not curve.

Couldn't imagine having a better professor for an upper division science course. He kept the class organized and showed up prepared to lecture. He focuses on teaching concepts rather than tedious details. Although, I recommend memorizing all 20 amino acids and the nucleotide bases ASAP, in order to save A LOT of time preparing for the first exam.
Unclear, sarcastic, not helpful. If anything, spend time reading from the book. I wouldn't recommend taking a class taught by him.

Professor Scott was amazing! His midterms were hard but he really wants his students to do well. Theoretically I shouldn't have passed this class considering I didn't pass the first 2 midterms but William cares so much that he was willing to replace my midterm grades with my final exam grade so long as I passed. Ended up with an A in the class!!!
I like this guy. And I don't know what everyone else is talking about - his tests are definitely not tricky. They are pretty straight forward and if you know your material then you'll do fine.
Prof. Scott is arrogant. I find him repeating the same big words (pedantic, heinous). He is not helpful and his class is useless. Go to section - you can learn everything from that.
Not useful in class. Redundant and spent too much time on unimportant topics. Unclear on expectations.

Pretty good teacher, his lectures are interesting and he's pretty good about explaining stuff.  He gave reviews before the midterm and final going over what he had put into them, those helped a lot, but they took place during lecture and weren't advertised.  Homework is assigned but not graded.

very arrogant. i had to teach myself the material. has no regard for students or for how well they do in his class. did not make him self available at ALL. horrible teacher, not so bad tests. if you are ready to teach yourself the material you will do fine.

His overall attitude is great but his ability to teach the subject lacks clarity.  He talks the talk but when you try to repeat what he says you sometimes get lost.  I suggest that if you have him for a class go to section rather than the lecture.

great guy, funny, witty, clever. knows his**** and is willing to teach it, if the student is willing to learn. difficult tests, but doable if you really understand the material. very effective teaching method--perfect teacher for you if you really want to put in the time and get more than you bargained for in return.

I think he's a pretty good lecturer but I found his tests nearly impossible and I don't think he really makes an effort to have his class fully understand everything and pass his tests. It is very unclear what will be on the midterms and final and unless you know chemistry backwards and forwards I believe the class will be very hard to pass.

he needs a towel while hes teahcing...i could hardly bare to look at him. comes off as the nice guy but is really out to trick you in the end. cover material well and is super enthusiastic which is good but could kick back on the jokes.

Excellent professor. Highly Recommended. His class is very tough, but if you put in the effort, you'll learn Chem. Lecture was great because explanations were clear and questions were welcome. Hmwk is mandatory. Exams are intense, but memorization won't get you anything. Knowing the material and being clever will. Enjoyed the class and got an A.

If you are gonna learn in the class, I suggest you take this class because his lectures are clear. Orderwise, if you wanted to pass this class, it's basically FreaKING HARD!!! Basically what Im trying to say is you gotta be smart to do good on the test. Memorization is not going to help you on his midterms and finals.. Plus, he is tricky. careful..

Great teaching capabilities. Bad test proctoring skills. Got issues of providing reveiw or any other kind of aid for midterms and finals, so beware. He's tough with the tests and all are bases on problem solving. Highly reccommend looking over the midterms after taking it and expecting the worst if you want to pass this class. Good luck.
he is absolutely fabulous. i learned a lot in this class and understood everything. truly recommend this prof for chem 1C! It was a great experience.

I think he's great. Hard class, obviously, but he presents it well, especially considering he's never taught it before this quarter. As for the first midterm, it was kind of trial and error with that one.
Finally a professor who treats us like intelligent individuals.  He is tough but fair, and demands a lot from us and himself.  The exams are all based on problem-solving, unlike 1a and 1b.
"I won't throw any trick questions to you guys." MY ASS!!! this teacher is a liar!!!
he could have a second carrer as a comedian
